result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on October 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
and disclosure

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
Branch 17

2:25 PM Defendant Elijah Lee Carter in court, in custody.  Attorney Adam Matthias Welch in court for Elijah Lee Carter.  Prosecuting attorney Cecilia E DeMarco in court for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to find cts 1 and 2 to be transactionally related. No objection by Defn., CT finds that cts 1 and 2 are transactionally related. Dane County Sheriff Sgt J. R., duly sworn and testified. Direct Exam by ADA DeMarco. Venue established. Witness identification. Cross Exam by Atty Welch. Redirect exam by ADA DeMarco. Witness excused. State moves for bind over, waived argument, reserve rebuttal. Defn objected to bind over. Argument by Atty Welch. CT found PC this defn committed a felony and bound over to branch 17.
Preliminary hearing on September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
from Atty Welch to reschedule the September 7, 2022 preliminary hearing
